1532110.name: Curatours
1532110.description:
Welcome to Curatours!

Curatours is a social tour platform for culture and heritage. Visit incredible places filled with art, artefacts, stories and friends. Visitors can access tours of museums around the world from desktop, phones or VR headsets. In VR it's an incredibly immersive experience and on other devices it feels like a cross between a video call and playing a multiplayer game.

Curatours is free to download and offers three types of cultural tour:

Self-Guided

Start a solo tour and explore the experiences at your own pace with this self-guided option.

Private Tour

Start or join a private online tour, using a private room code to keep you in control of who can join your tour group.

Public Tour

Jump in to an online public tour to share and explore together with other members of the public.

Virtual Spaces for Culture, Museums and Galleries

Curatours offers visitors a wide range of interactive experiences, from local museums to cultural and historic exhibitions. The virtual spaces allow visitors to get up close and personal with animals, artworks, and artefacts in ways not possible in the real world, all from the comfort of their own homes!

Download Curatours for free today and experience:

Bradford District Museum and Galleries

The Bradford District is home to some of the most exciting museums and galleries in the UK. We are thrilled to host a pilot exhibit, leading to a programme of work celebrating Bradford as the 2025 City of Culture 2025.

  • Uncover strange stone markings amongst the ancient neolithic moors

  • Get up close and personal with a historic haunted night in Bolling Hall

  • Explore the Belle Vue photography studio, where local Bradford people were immortalised in film between 1902 and 1975

Museum of Colour

Too often we ignore the many achievements of the generations that came before us. The ‘Respect Due’ project aims to capture as many of these unique perspectives as possible, showcasing a selection of individuals through art, audio interviews and personal artefacts.

Curatours is proud to offer a permanent virtual home for the exhibit, and showcase an exciting step for the Museum of Colour in their mission to open up new avenues for accessibility, inclusivity, and the preservation of cultural heritage in an increasingly digital world.

Museum of Plastic 2121

Visit a future where single use plastics are only ever found in museums.

Museum of Plastic 2121 is an imagined future museum, built to teach future generations about plastics and tell the story of how activism started in 2021 led to the positive change that resulted in us cleaning up our oceans and forever changing our relationship with plastic.

Taking inspiration from the Solarpunk movement, Curatours worked closely with South African activists Greenpop and Baz-Art, utlising some of their real world murals and 3D paintings.

Built 100 years from now in an imagined future where things have worked out well for both the planet and humanity, the exhibit is perfectly at home on the Curatours platform which isn’t constrained by time or space.

and more!
